channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Pokémon Winds and Pokémon Waves officially announced for 2027 with three new starter Pokémon, and it's probably going to be a Nintendo Switch 2 exclusive
item.description: The Pokémon Company has announced the next mainline entries in the long-running video game series, Pokémon WindsandPokémon Waves, launching in 2027 for Nintendo Switch 2.

item.title: Compacte, cette batterie externe de 12 000 mAh et 100 W avec deux ports perd 20 % de son prix
item.description: Légère et pratique à transporter, la batterie externe Ugreen Nexode est dotée d'une capacité de 12 000 mAh et d'une puissance de 100 W. De quoi recharger vos appareils plusieurs fois de façon rapide. Actuellement, on la trouve à 39,98 euros au lieu de 49,99 euros sur Amazon.

item.title: Pokémon Winds and Waves are coming to Switch 2 in 2027
item.description: The Pokémon leakers were right: the Gen 10 games are called Pokémon Wind and Pokémon Waves. The Pokémon Company confirmed the titles during a 30th anniversary stream on Pokémon Day. The games are set to hit Nintendo Switch 2 in 2027. (A Game Freak leak last October suggested Wind and Waves would be out this year with DLC to follow in 2027.)According to the Pokémon account on X, in Wind and Waves, “you’ll travel across beautiful windswept islands and a vast ocean with glittering waves that ebb and flow. You’ll also team up with Pokémon to overcome challenges and even the forces of nature!” They...

item.title: Here’s your first look at Kratos in Amazon’s God of War show
item.description: Amazon has slowly been teasing out casting details for its live-action adaptation of God of War, and now we have our first look at the show. It's a single image but a notable one showing protagonist Kratos and his son Atreus. The characters are played by Ryan Hurst and Callum Vinson, respectively, and they look […]

item.title: The Galaxy S26 is a photography nightmare
item.description: In many ways, Samsung's new phones are fairly normal upgrades. The S26 lines come with some useful new things - particularly the Privacy Display on the S26 Ultra, which looks like an extremely cool bit of tech and a really useful new feature - and a lot of iterative year-over-year changes. The new camera features, […]

item.title: Fini les problèmes visuels sur la PS5 Pro ? Sony annonce une importante mise à jour
item.description: Après des débuts compliqués, le PSSR de la PS5 Pro tente de se refaire une santé. Sony a dévoilé une nouvelle version de sa technologie d’upscaling, peaufinée avec AMD, et promet enfin une image plus stable et plus précise.

item.title: A worrying Wi-Fi vulnerability can bypass home and office network encryption - here's how to stay safe
item.description: Wi-Fi Client Isolation is not the security measure we thought it was, so be on youir guard.

item.title: Pokémon Winds and Waves launch on the Switch 2 in 2027
item.description: It's time to say goodbye to the Paldea region because a new generation of mainline Pokémon games are on the way. During today's big Pokémon Presents stream, Nintendo announced that Pokémon Wind and Waves are the next installments in the core game series. The games will launch in 2027 and are exclusive for the Nintendo […]

item.title: The Morning After: The Galaxy S26 Ultra’s Privacy Display is pretty cool
item.description: Samsung’s Unpacked event midweek revealed three new phones and two sets of earbuds, but the real standout, as usual, is the Galaxy S26 Ultra. This year, the Ultra actually features a bit of genuine tech innovation — and no, we don’t mean it folds. Let’s talk about its new Privacy Display. This isn't a shimmery, holographic screen protector that’s hard to read and constantly peels off at the corners; this tech is engineered directly into the S26 Ultra’s OLED display. Samsung Display revealed its Flex Magic Pixel technology back in 2024. The S26 Ultra’s Privacy Display is built off the back of t...

item.title: Huel tries to solve the ‘burden’ of eating
item.description: This is Optimizer, a weekly newsletter sent every Friday from Verge senior reviewer Victoria Song that dissects and discusses the latest gizmos and potions that swear they're going to change your life. Opt in for Optimizer here. In 2017, I was at rock bottom. My dad's health was rapidly failing; my relationship with my mom […]

item.title: Last 24 hours to get TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 tickets at the lowest rates of the year
item.description: The lowest rates of the year for TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 end after today. Prices go up at 11:59 p.m. PT. Don't miss connecting with 10,000 founders, investors, and operators, and key takeaways from 250+ industry leaders. Register now to save up to $680, or up to 30% on group passes.

item.title: Engadget Podcast: Xbox's leadership shakeup and Samsung's Galaxy S26
item.description: This week, we're diving into the big changes at Xbox and what it all means for Microsoft's gaming future. Phil Spencer, the longtime face of Xbox, announced he's retiring last week. He'll be replaced by Microsoft's former CoreAI CEO Asha Sharma, instead of his longtime deputy Sarah Bond, who plans to leave the company. Will this change actually help the beleaguered Xbox division, or is it another example of Microsoft shoving AI into everything? Also, Samsung held its latest Unpacked event this week to announce its new Galaxy S26 family. They look pretty much the same as last year, but the Ultr...

item.title: 'Today, frontier AI systems are simply not reliable enough to power fully autonomous weapons' — Anthropic CEO on why it won't agree to Pete Hegseth's scary request
item.description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei is denying the US Department of War's request to use Claude AI for surveillance and warfare – and this is the best AI news we've heard in a while.

item.title: OpenAI snags $110 billion in investments from Amazon, Nvidia, and Softbank
item.description: OpenAI has closed another round of funding, totalling $110 billion being newly committed to the maker of ChatGPT, which it says has more than 900 million weekly active users and over 50 million consumer subscribers. Amazon is investing $50 billion and striking a deal that includes plans for custom models and more. Nvidia and SoftBank […]

item.title: Perplexity « Computer » : l’IA qui recrute d’autres IA pour faire votre travail à votre place
item.description: Vous rêviez de déléguer la création de votre application ou la gestion d'une campagne marketing à une machine ? Perplexity vient de lancer « Computer », un super-agent capable de découper un projet complexe et de le distribuer à une armée de modèles d'intelligence artificielle pour l'exécuter à votre place.

item.title: 'We see an opportunity to move faster with smaller, highly talented teams using AI to automate more work': Block decimates workforce in favor of AI
item.description: Jack Dorsey's Block will remove 4,000 workers from its 10,000-strong team, all because AI can get the job done for less.

item.title: HBO Max en mars 2025 : voici les films et séries à ne pas manquer (avant que ça parte chez Paramount)
item.description: La vente de Warner Bros. Discovery (et donc de HBO Max) vient de prendre un nouveau tournant, alors il serait peut-être temps de profiter de ces films et séries avant que ça ne parte chez Paramount... ou Netflix.

item.title: After Zomato, Deepinder Goyal returns with a $54M brain-monitoring bet
item.description: Zomato co-founder Deepinder Goyal's new wearable startup Temple has raised $54 million in a friends-and-family round at a post-money valuation of about $190 million.

item.title: No data shared — Private Internet Access reinforces its no-log claims with independent audit and transparency report
item.description: The VPN provider has successfully passed its third no-log audit since its first certification in 2022. Here's all you need to know.

item.title: There’s a Wild Reason Scotch Tape Screeches—and It Has to Do With the Speed of Sound
item.description: Fractures travel along the adhesive at nearly twice the speed of sound, producing tiny sonic booms.

item.title: I've been using these super-cheap headphones for a month — I'm surprised to report they sound great
item.description: The OneOdio Focus A1 Pro are bargain headphones, with a great sound and long-lasting battery. They aren't without flaws though, so check this review before you buy.

item.title: Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen go live — where to buy now for Nintendo Switch
item.description: Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen land on the Switch eShop for $19.99 on Pokémon Day 2026, with pre-load support and classic Kanto gameplay.

item.title: Ceci n’est pas une Gameboy : Pokémon annonce Game Music Collection, un lecteur de musique pour Rouge et Bleu
item.description: Le Pokémon Presents qui vient d'annoncer la 10e génération de Pokémon a débuté par l'annonce d'un objet étrange. Le Game Music Collection est un objet dédié à l'écoute de vos musiques de Pokémon Rouge et Bleu.

item.title: Ces écouteurs Motorola à l’autonomie généreuse bradés à moins de 100 € vont ravir les sportifs
item.description: Les plus grands sportifs pourront s'équiper de ces Motorola Moto Buds Loop pour de longues sessions de sport grâce à leur autonomie de huit heures. Ils sont actuellement disponibles avec une remise de 33 %.

item.title: OpenAI raises $110B in one of the largest private funding rounds in history
item.description: The new funding consists of a $50 billion investment from Amazon as well as $30 billion each from Nvidia and SoftBank, against a $730 billion valuation.

item.title: Netflix isn’t buying Warner Bros: all of the latest updates

It’s just the latest twist in the acquisition saga, which started with a bidding war that […]

item.title: Decathlon va mettre des airbags dans ses vêtements
item.description: Le géant français Decathlon s’associe à la start-up française In&Motion afin d’intégrer des airbags électroniques à certains de ses équipements sportifs.

item.title: Duolingo stock is falling off a cliff, continuing a dramatic collapse. You can’t just blame that ‘AI first’ memo
item.description: Investors are dumping Duolingo after it released underwhelming guidance for 2026. Shares have seen their value slashed since their high point in May 2025. It’s a horrible day for investors in Duolingo. Shares of the language learning app with the green owl mascot are falling off a cliff after the company reported its fourth quarter results.

item.title: Memory shortage could cause the biggest dip in smartphone shipments in over a decade
item.description: IDC says phone makers will ship only 1.12 billion smartphones as compared to 1.26 billion last year.

item.description: We trust a lot of our day-to-day browsing to our home Wi-Fi connection, but are there any gaping security gaps?

item.title: Google Messages déploie son option de partage de localisation en direct
item.description: Quelques jours après avoir été repérée, la fonctionnalité de partage de localisation en direct commence à faire son apparition sur Google Messages. De quoi retrouver facilement un contact perdu dans la foule.

item.title: Nvidia fait machine arrière en catastrophe sur ses derniers drivers, handicapants pour certaines machines
item.description: Pour la première fois depuis fort longtemps, Nvidia a annoncé faire machine arrière sur le déploiement d'un driver Game Ready / RTX Studio. Ce dernier générait, notamment, d'importants problèmes de contrôle des ventilateurs du GPU sur certaines machines.

Last year’s event included the announcement of Pokémon Champions, and the 2026 edition should be […]

item.title: Attendus en mars, les Samsung Galaxy A37 et A57 devraient vraiment s’améliorer au niveau de l’autonomie

item.description: The Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra's S Pen may not play nicely with some magnetic cases, but a future S Pen could solve this problem.
